result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrica J Thurman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Second/Subsequent Drug Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically vocational training.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected - 01-18-2016 at 10:00 am
Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction.

Defendant Darrica J Thurman in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties are in receipt of PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties, however, the State has some questions regarding some statements made by defendant in PSI. The State indicated that poster has requested cash bond be returned. The Court takes judicial notice of the two complaints for Trace McKay. Defense indicates deft told her the "Mack" defendant was referring to was not Trace McKay. That State agrees to follow PSI which calls for I/S sentence and probation.

 BTC: In 14CF1210-Total sentence is 3 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mos IC, 18 mos ES/CFTS - I/S. 2 yrs probation
              15CF565-Total sentence is 9 mos RCJ. May participate with ZCI program. DNA costs, costs.
                                      DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY
Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically vocational training

FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and ERP if revoked.

Sentencing hearing on June 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Darrica J Thurman
Current: 3615 19th Street, Racine, WI 53403 United States  (Effective: 04-28-2015)
Prior: 1915 Washington Ave, Racine, WI 53403

DEFEDANT POSTED $500.00 ON 11/21/2014 AND THEREFORE NEED ONLY POST AN ADDITIONAL $500.00. Ct 1: 961.41(3g)(c)-PCS/Cocaine. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Sentencing hearing on June 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
